metadata.title: CVE-2022-33099 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
An issue in the component luaG_runerror of Lua v5.4.4 and below leads to aheap-buffer overflow when a recursive error occurs.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-33099` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblua5.4-0 - 5.4.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
lua5.4 - 5.4.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: lua5.4 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
